Authors:
Uwe Braun, Rojer T. A. Cook, Monika Götz, C. Preston,
Susumu Takamatsu
Title: Podosphaera lini (Ascomycota, Erysiphales) revisited
Keywords:
powdery mildew, Linum, phylogeny, taxonomy, Oidium
lini
Abstract:
Podosphaera lini (Erysiphaceae) has recently been detected
on Linum usutatissimum in UK and represents the first unequivocal record
of this powdery mildew from Great Britain. The history of powdery mildew
on flax in UK is critically discussed. DNA sequence data (ITS) have been
retrieved from the British material and in additional from a German
collection and used for phylogenetic analyses. The position of P. lini
as species of its own in the genus Podosphaera, close to P. macularis
(hop powdery mildew), could be confirmed, which is in concordance with
morphological traits of the flax powdery mildew, above all with small
peridial cells of the chasmothecia, placing this species in Podosphaera
sect. Podosphaera subsect. Podosphaera. Oidium lini, described from
Croatia, was previously erroneously reduced to synonymy with
Golovinomyces orontii, but this species names has been reassessed and is
now regarded as a synonym of Podosphaera lini. Oidium lini, cited in
literature as name published by Bondartsev in 1913, is critically
discussed and shown to be very doubtful, i.e., this name has probably
never been validly introduced.
